description: Test suite with actual code fragments in ground_truth_contexts

questions.question: Describe Category class
questions.correct_answer: Category is a JPA entity class that represents webinar categories. It has three fields: categoryId (auto-generated ID), name (String), and webinars (Set of Webinar objects in a many-to-many relationship). The class has constructors and standard getters/setters.
ground_truth_contexts: @Entity public class Category { @Id @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY) private int categoryId; private String name; @ManyToMany(mappedBy = "categories") private Set<Webinar> webinars = new HashSet<>();
public Category(String name) { this.name = name; } public Category() { } public int getCategoryId() { return categoryId; } public String getName() { return name; }
key_facts: Has categoryId, name, and webinars fields

questions.question: How does method enrollStudentIntoWebinar work?
questions.correct_answer: The method retrieves webinar and user from repositories, validates that the user is not already enrolled, checks that the user is not the lecturer, verifies there are no overlapping webinars, then enrolls the student and saves both entities.
ground_truth_contexts: Webinar webinar = webinarRepository.findById(webinarId).orElseThrow(() -> new WebinarNotFoundException(webinarId)); User user = userRepository.findById(userId).orElseThrow(() -> new UserNotFoundException(userId));
if (webinar.getStudents().contains(user) || user.getWebinars().contains(webinar)) { throw new UserAlreadyEnrolledException(userId, webinarId); }

Set<Webinar> overlappingWebinars = overlappingWebinarsForUser(user, webinar); if (!overlappingWebinars.isEmpty()) { throw new WebinarOverlappingException(userId, webinarId, overlappingWebinarsDetails); }
key_facts: Takes webinarId and userId as parameters
Enrolls and saves if validations pass

questions.question: What exceptions can method enrollStudentIntoWebinar throw?
questions.correct_answer: The method can throw five exceptions: WebinarNotFoundException, UserNotFoundException, UserAlreadyEnrolledException, LecturerCantEnrollIntoOwnWebinar, and WebinarOverlappingException.
key_facts: Throws WebinarNotFoundException when webinar not found
Throws UserNotFoundException when user not found
Throws LecturerCantEnrollIntoOwnWebinar when user is lecturer

questions.question: What tests exist for ClassroomController?
questions.correct_answer: ClassroomControllerTest contains six test methods covering CRUD operations: shouldReturnAllClassrooms, shouldReturnClassroomById, shouldReturnClassroomsByAddress, shouldCreateClassroom, shouldUpdateClassroom, and shouldDeleteClassroom.
key_facts: Tests GET, POST, PUT, DELETE endpoints

questions.question: Where is method updateWebinar used?
questions.correct_answer: The updateWebinar method is used in WebinarController in a PUT endpoint mapped to /webinars/{id}. The controller calls webinarService.updateWebinar and returns the updated webinar.
ground_truth_contexts: @PutMapping("/{id}") public ResponseEntity<WebinarDto> updateWebinar(@PathVariable int id, @RequestBody WebinarDto webinarDto) { WebinarDto updatedWebinar = webinarService.updateWebinar(id, webinarDto);
@Test void testUpdateWebinar() { WebinarDto result = webinarService.updateWebinar(webinarId, updatedWebinarDto);

questions.question: What are the most important classes in the project?
questions.correct_answer: The most important classes are WebinarService (core business logic), WebinarController (REST API), and Webinar (central domain entity).
